Unplanned content changes detected on in.Action: Monitor internal web server logs (access, error) and application logs for unusual GET/POST requests, status codes, or error messages indicative of content modification attempts. Use time series analysis on web request volume/type to detect anomalies. Implement automated content monitoring tools or integrity checks on critical internal web pages and login banners. Analyze Zeek http.log for suspicious activity like mass uploads or modifications.

Anomalous application or system log entr.Data: Windows Event ID 4688, Windows Event ID 4656, Windows Event ID 4663, Application Logs
Anomalous application or system log entr.Action: Monitor Windows Event logs (4688, 4656, 4663) for processes attempting to modify system files, registry keys (especially those related to desktop settings, logon screens), or execute commands associated with file manipulation or display settings. Analyze process execution paths and command line arguments. Use frequency analysis on file modification events for unusual patterns.
